article_title: Succeeding In The Healthcare Industry As A Marketer

article_metadata.author: Kimberly A. Whitler

og.description: Five years ago, you wouldn’t have seen a healthcare Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) that came from another industry. Today, with reimbursements decreasing and risk shifting, hospitals and health systems have to act like other businesses: engaging their consumers and prospects, communicating with them, and having relationships with them. They also have to generate demand for their profitable and high-value services. Because this is new territory, the healthcare industry has begun bringing CMOs (and other marketing leaders) in from outside the industry. However, anytime somebody switches industries, there is increased risk as the individual needs to learn about the role, the company, and the industry. To better understand how marketers new to healthcare can successfully make the shift, I turned to Kristin Hambelton, CMO from Evariant, the provider of an innovative CRM platform built specifically for the healthcare industry.
